question: 忙しい
sourceMnemonic: This is a single kanji with <ja>しい</ja> on the end, meaning it's an adjective. What's the adjective form of <kanji>busy</kanji>? It's also <vocabulary>busy</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: You're <vocabulary>busy</vocabulary> because you have to take care of your friend's <reading>ice ogre</reading>s (<ja>いそが</ja>) this weekend. You don't know why you agreed to this, you were busy enough, but now you'll never get anything done running around taking care of these little ice ogres.
